column5: I'll be crossing the border to Canada in Aug. I will be using my son's suv to pull my boat. He won't be with me and I'm wondering if I would have any problem with the border crossing, and if I will need anything special. Help....................
[font color=green size=3][b]Proof of insurance can be an issue, and it wouldn't hurt to have a letter of permision from the owner, as they run every licence plate through the computer at the border.
I have never taken a boat, but I was told that they will tax you on any gas in it. I don't know if this info is reliable.
[font color=green size=3][b]Fuel in the vehicle or the boat plus "a reasonable amount" is not taxed when you cross the border.
Thanks for the input. It's pretty much as I expected and it's nice to have my thoughts varified.
